channel.title: linux on Josef Erben's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Josef Erben's Blog

item.title: Ignoring Files with Dropbox on Linux
item.description: On Linux you can set attributes to ignore files for syncing.

item.title: How To Fix Bash Autocompletion on Elastic Beanstalk When Using SSH
item.description: If you use urxvt to connect to your EC2 instance through Elastic Beanstalk, running eb ssh will give you a shell where autocomplete does not work. Fix that by running TERM='xterm-256color' eb ssh

item.title: Thinkpad T14 with NixOS and I3WM
item.description: 3 months ago I installed NixOS, i3wm and XFCE on my new Thinkpad T14 (1st Gen). It is my main machine that I use every day. In this blog post I summarize my experience with this setup.

item.title: Captive Portals in Coffee Shops and Hotels using Linux
item.description: You sit in a cozy coffee place and you just finished your coffee. You are still not connected to the WiFi while the MacBooks and Surface devices around you have sent and received Gigabytes of data since you sat down. You are a Linux user.

item.title: How to Generate Random Strings on Linux in One Line
item.description: With following command you can print a random string of a certain length on Linux. tr -dc A-Za-z0-9 </dev/urandom | head -c 32 ; echo '' The string is safe to use in most web contexts such as HTML forms or environment variables.

item.title: Play Anno 1404 Venice on Proton
item.description: In order to play Anno 1404 on Proton, follow these steps.

item.title: Autostart Dropbox on NixOS using I3WM
item.description: Install Dropbox using NixOS in your preferred way.
